GT.content: [via psychoanalysis] circulation of auto-affective fantasmatics [imaginative incorporation] can disregard overflow of luxury or recognize in it an essential economic function
GT.linkedContent: [via psychoanalysis] circulation of auto-affective fantasmatics [imaginative incorporation] can disregard overflow of luxury or recognize in it an essential economic function

AF.content: psychoanalysis formed in the time of postal delay
psychoanalysis is not a depth psychology

archivology (interdisciplinary science of archive) risks being paralyzed in preliminary aporia: 1) treat psychoanalysis as general science of the archive 2) place itself under the critical authority of psychoanalysis (disputing it while integrating its logic)

AF.content: can one presuppose closure, identity of psychoanalytic corpus?
AF.linkedContent: can one presuppose closure, identity of psychoanalytic corpus?

AF.content: acc. Yerushalmi, psychoanalysis would be Judaism w/out God
AF.linkedContent: acc. Yerushalmi, psychoanalysis would be Judaism w/out God

MC.content: “psychoanalysis,” “literature”—proper names that point to historical, singular events or series of events; p. 345 it is not certain such “worlds” exist
MC.linkedContent: “psychoanalysis,” “literature”—proper names that point to historical, singular events or series of events; p. 345 it is not certain such “worlds” exist

MC.content: what happens when a science implicates the subject itself of the science, i.e. psychoanalysis?
MC.linkedContent: what happens when a science implicates the subject itself of the science, i.e. psychoanalysis?

MC.content: paranoia? superstition? science? all restore meaning to random signs
MC.linkedContent: paranoia? superstition? science? all restore meaning to random signs

MC.content: deliberate self-limitation gives psychoanalysis a chance of being a science
MC.linkedContent: deliberate self-limitation gives psychoanalysis a chance of being a science

HASD.content: onto-theological, metaphysical presuppositions sustain psychoanalytic theorems

PP.content: Oedipus as pharmakos [Derrida’s distances himself from psychoanalysis]

S.content: avoidance, denegation, categories of psychoanalysis, inadequate when it comes to questions of Being
S.linkedContent: avoidance, denegation, categories of psychoanalysis, inadequate when it comes to questions of Being

FSW.content: why Derrida won’t utilize Freud’s psychoanalytic concepts

thought of trace fecundated by psychoanalysis: 1) study writing in a psychopathology of everyday life 2) a history of writing 3) a psychoanalysis of literature respectful of originality of the literary signifier (not yet begun) 4) problematize boundaries, psychoanalytic graphology (i.e. Melanie Klein)
FSW.linkedContent: thought of trace fecundated by psychoanalysis: 1) study writing in a psychopathology of everyday life 2) a history of writing 3) a psychoanalysis of literature respectful of originality of the literary signifier (not yet begun) 4) problematize boundaries, psychoanalytic graphology (i.e. Melanie Klein)

F.content: [re: Abraham’s psychoanalysis] joy of breaking wall btwn rational & irrational, condition necessary for “scientific truth and poetic truth” to belong to “same essence”
F.linkedContent: [re: Abraham’s psychoanalysis] joy of breaking wall btwn rational & irrational, condition necessary for “scientific truth and poetic truth” to belong to “same essence”

F.content: this poetic truth not gratuitous literary estheticism, nor unveiling presence > truth is “poetic” in that it writes a text on and in a text, hieroglyph on hieroglyph h
F.linkedContent: this poetic truth not gratuitous literary estheticism, nor unveiling presence > truth is “poetic” in that it writes a text on and in a text, hieroglyph on hieroglyph h

F.content: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology
F.linkedContent: via Abraham’s “radical semantic change that psychoanalysis introduced into language,” beneath paleonymy of inherited concepts, working w/ remnants [i.e. beneath “pleasure” we find pain]: to bring intending non-presence into phenomenology

F.content: via Abraham, in deciphering poem, “translator” has written one: poetic translation or psychoanalytic interpretation [re: “ghost”] > clears path for other w/out unilateral privilege
F.linkedContent: via Abraham, in deciphering poem, “translator” has written one: poetic translation or psychoanalytic interpretation [re: “ghost”] > clears path for other w/out unilateral privilege

FWT.content: fixed model of oedipal theory in Lacan & Freud > stable father, irreplaceable mother; transformation of family would transform psychoanalysis
FWT.linkedContent: fixed model of oedipal theory in Lacan & Freud > stable father, irreplaceable mother; transformation of family would transform psychoanalysis

FWT.content: psychoanalysis always wanted to be a psychoanalysis of families
FWT.linkedContent: psychoanalysis always wanted to be a psychoanalysis of families

FWT.content: law integrates possibility of psychoanalysis, can you convict someone who is only showing symptoms of racism?
FWT.linkedContent: law integrates possibility of psychoanalysis, can you convict someone who is only showing symptoms of racism?

FWT.content: “secret” space of psychoanalysis calls for law of other

“friends of psychoanalysis”—affirm necessity of psychoanalysis’ future-to-come > consider whether psychoanalysis has yet to take place “up until now” > such a vigilant “friend” affirms, says “yes,” to its “secret” space, which calls for another ethics, law, rigor
FWT.linkedContent: “friends of psychoanalysis”—affirm necessity of psychoanalysis’ future-to-come > consider whether psychoanalysis has yet to take place “up until now” > such a vigilant “friend” affirms, says “yes,” to its “secret” space, which calls for another ethics, law, rigor

FWT.content: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)
FWT.linkedContent: psychoanalytic aim > not to seek refuge in a theological/humanist alibi > Derrida seduced by psychoanalysis’ audacity of thought, its courage, signing theoretical “fictions” in name of a knowledge w/out alibi (thus, the most “positive” knowledge”)

FWT.content: [re: psychoanalysis’ method, teaching?] debt of all theoretical (juridical, ethical & political) positing to a performative power structured by a fiction, by figural invention: “the convention that guarantees every performative inscribes within itself the credit that is conferred upon a fiction”
FWT.linkedContent: [re: psychoanalysis’ method, teaching?] debt of all theoretical (juridical, ethical & political) positing to a performative power structured by a fiction, by figural invention: “the convention that guarantees every performative inscribes within itself the credit that is conferred upon a fiction”

FWT.content: Freud’s machines & Lacan’s are substantialized—differance erases/displaces their borders
how we proceed as if psychoanalysis never happened, as if we still believed in sovereign authority of ego, speak the language of “autonomy”
FWT.linkedContent: how we proceed as if psychoanalysis never happened, as if we still believed in sovereign authority of ego, speak the language of “autonomy”

FWT.content: the charters that govern psychoanalysis are not psychoanalytical
FWT.linkedContent: the charters that govern psychoanalysis are not psychoanalytical

POOF.content: we shall laugh interminably at Ferenczi’s letter to Freud [Ferenczi treats Freud like a father–god], we shall also take it seriously [see p. 279 for a swift recap of all questions in POOF, now associated, via this letter, w/ psychoanalysis]
POOF.linkedContent: we shall laugh interminably at Ferenczi’s letter to Freud [Ferenczi treats Freud like a father–god], we shall also take it seriously [see p. 279 for a swift recap of all questions in POOF, now associated, via this letter, w/ psychoanalysis]

POOF.content: psychoanalysis would have happened in event of non-event [?]
POOF.linkedContent: psychoanalysis would have happened in event of non-event [?]

POS.content: Derrida fractures hermetic closure that shelters question of writing from psychoanalysis, blinding psychoanalytic discourse from the textual scene
POS.linkedContent: Derrida fractures hermetic closure that shelters question of writing from psychoanalysis, blinding psychoanalytic discourse from the textual scene

ROP.content: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn
ROP.linkedContent: [here] analytic concern merges w/ hermeneutic drive, w/ principle of reason (reddere rationem): render sense at all cost (à tout prix), il faut rendre: fidelity, debt, duty, to restitute sense of sense > even if hidden, verborgene Sinn

ROP.content: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)
ROP.linkedContent: psychoanalysis is in principle nonhypnotic, affirms right to resistance to hypnosis (and said resistance’s insurmountability)

ROP.content: violence of psychoanalysis, actively counters forces of resistance
ROP.linkedContent: violence of psychoanalysis, actively counters forces of resistance

ROP.content: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value
ROP.linkedContent: violence of psychoanalysis: turn resister into “collaborator” (Freud’s words), or then deprive patient’s defenses of all value

ROP.content: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)
ROP.linkedContent: paralysis gives movement w/ regard to its other [this is in reference to impossibility of psychoanalysis’ auto-interpretation] (in PAS, paralysis distinguished from logic of analysis)

ROP.content: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]
ROP.linkedContent: pourquoi mon explication avec l’analyse [psychoanalysis] a toujours eu ce goût de mort en poste restante qui m’a poussé à rôder sans fin dans les parages de Beyond the Pleasure Principle [?]

ROP.content: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable
ROP.linkedContent: repetition compulsion (advocatus diaboli of death drive) as resource & limit (à la fois) of psychoanalysis > analytic position set going endlessly, w/out Aufhebung, in paradox of Bindung and Erlöschung (solution, extinction): no analytic position when resistance is unidentifiable

ROP.content: analysis is interminable because there is no indivisible/simple element
ROP.linkedContent: analysis is interminable because there is no indivisible/simple element

ROP.content: double bind (preferable to double contrainte), is the call to analysis: one can never fully analyze it, one can only untie one of its knots by making the other tighter: stricture
ROP.linkedContent: double bind (preferable to double contrainte), is the call to analysis: one can never fully analyze it, one can only untie one of its knots by making the other tighter: stricture

ROP.content: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression
ROP.linkedContent: ash, stepping beyond psychoanalysis, radical destruction of archive, destroys capitalizing reserve, the guarding of repression

ROP.content: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?
ROP.linkedContent: what happens when you apply chiasmatic invagination of borders to analysis? to its phallogocentrism (mastery)? > can psychoanalysis belong to anyone, anymore?

ROP.content: death drive (repetition compulsion, fort/da), Evil Genius of Freud, the devil’s advocate, limping devil: by way of which psychoanalysis finds its speculative power & its greatest resistance
ROP.linkedContent: death drive (repetition compulsion, fort/da), Evil Genius of Freud, the devil’s advocate, limping devil: by way of which psychoanalysis finds its speculative power & its greatest resistance

ROP.content: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)
ROP.linkedContent: for Foucault, psychoanalysis oscillates on both sides of dividing line, in two places, two times, at same time (but he does not think these two times w/ structural possibility of event)

O.content: same denial at work in Greater Logic when preface is placed in parentheses as when psychoanalytic phallocentrism places anatomy in parentheses?
O.linkedContent: same denial at work in Greater Logic when preface is placed in parentheses as when psychoanalytic phallocentrism places anatomy in parentheses?

PSSS.content: Derrida doesn’t [:)] draw link btwn non-bloody cruelty & the Jewish joke about analyst who chose his profession because he didn’t like sight of blood [doesn’t want to reopen history of Judaism & potential universality of psychoanalysis]
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida doesn’t [:)] draw link btwn non-bloody cruelty & the Jewish joke about analyst who chose his profession because he didn’t like sight of blood [doesn’t want to reopen history of Judaism & potential universality of psychoanalysis]

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis allows to think: the suffering for the pleasure of it (just to, just for), the worst cruelty, suffer to suffer, making/letting oneself suffer
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis allows to think: the suffering for the pleasure of it (just to, just for), the worst cruelty, suffer to suffer, making/letting oneself suffer

PSSS.content: possibility of a drive of cruelty is reduced/excluded by theological, genetic, physicalist, cognitivist, metaphysical discourses
PSSS.linkedContent: possibility of a drive of cruelty is reduced/excluded by theological, genetic, physicalist, cognitivist, metaphysical discourses

PSSS.content: “psychoanalysis” turned toward what is most proper to psychical cruelty, w/out alibi
PSSS.linkedContent: “psychoanalysis” turned toward what is most proper to psychical cruelty, w/out alibi

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis as another name for “w/out alibi”: questions radical evil or an even worse evil > only psychoanalytic revolution up to task of taking account of grammatical syntax, reflexivity: [“I you we made I you we suffer”]
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis as another name for “w/out alibi”: questions radical evil or an even worse evil > only psychoanalytic revolution up to task of taking account of grammatical syntax, reflexivity: [“I you we made I you we suffer”]

PSSS.content: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other
PSSS.linkedContent: Derrida evokes a beyond the death drive, beyond pleasure/reality principle, beyond drive for sovereign mastery, beyond cruelty—beyond the “mythology of drives” > the undecidable in psychoanalysis, the impossible other

PSSS.content: cruelty & sovereignty (very obscure things) pose a resistance to psychoanalysis, just as psychoanalysis resists them > this border (inside/outside) of psychoanalysis bears weight of our questions: historical, ethical, juridical, political
PSSS.linkedContent: cruelty & sovereignty (very obscure things) pose a resistance to psychoanalysis, just as psychoanalysis resists them > this border (inside/outside) of psychoanalysis bears weight of our questions: historical, ethical, juridical, political

PSSS.content: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?
PSSS.linkedContent: all which resists psychoanalysis in the mondialisation of today, e.g. psycho-pharmacological medicine, positivist science, but mainly an archaic onto-theological metaphysics of sovereignty, individual or state (freedom, consciousness, intention, ego, will), barely scratched or thought or deconstructed by psychoanalysis—is this psychoanalysis’ own autoimmunity? its resistance?

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, DP, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis has failed to think, change axioms, of ethical, political, juridical sovereignty, where most cruel/traumatic events take place today; also, psych. has failed to think unprecedented juridical performatives: Human Rights, DP, international penal system, laws against cruel & unusual punishment…

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis will be left behind if it doesn’t analyze mutation of subject of the subject, citizen subject

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis has failed to say anything original about mondialisation, tele-technic virtuality—has resisted, in autoimmune fashion, changing, thinking through, fundamental axioms of ethics, law, politics > must be a revolution re: concepts cruelty, sovereignty, resistance
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis has failed to say anything original about mondialisation, tele-technic virtuality—has resisted, in autoimmune fashion, changing, thinking through, fundamental axioms of ethics, law, politics > must be a revolution re: concepts cruelty, sovereignty, resistance

PSSS.content: grievances (complaints, demands) of psychoanalysis: internal (problem of its institutionalization & dispersion) and external (relations to state, society, mondialisation) > what is proper not proper to psychoanalysis re: these borders, who addresses the grievance to whom?
PSSS.linkedContent: grievances (complaints, demands) of psychoanalysis: internal (problem of its institutionalization & dispersion) and external (relations to state, society, mondialisation) > what is proper not proper to psychoanalysis re: these borders, who addresses the grievance to whom?

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis’ native culture: European, Graeco-Abrahamic, liberal-bourgeois
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis’ native culture: European, Graeco-Abrahamic, liberal-bourgeois

PSSS.content: if psychoanalysis taught us one thing: beware autonomy, supposed freedom, alleged spontaneity
PSSS.linkedContent: if psychoanalysis taught us one thing: beware autonomy, supposed freedom, alleged spontaneity

PSSS.content: each psychoanalytic session, a micro-revolution, enfranchisement of regained spontaneity, freedom of speech, image/music of States General
PSSS.linkedContent: each psychoanalytic session, a micro-revolution, enfranchisement of regained spontaneity, freedom of speech, image/music of States General

PSSS.linkedContent: will theater of psychoanalysis always be royal family, patriarchal, heterosexual? will it always treat sexual difference as binary opposition?

PSSS.content: resistance of Arabo-Islamic culture, East Asia, to psychoanalysis (Judeo-Christian Greek?)
PSSS.linkedContent: resistance of Arabo-Islamic culture, East Asia, to psychoanalysis (Judeo-Christian Greek?)

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis is ineradicable, its revolution is irreversible—yet, like civilization, it’s mortal
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis is ineradicable, its revolution is irreversible—yet, like civilization, it’s mortal

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis only “science” that intrinsically involves the proper name of its founder, a transferential filiation it claims to be able to analyze
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis only “science” that intrinsically involves the proper name of its founder, a transferential filiation it claims to be able to analyze

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis hasn’t yet treated DP, sovereignty in general, it needs to > otherwise, double resistance both of world to psychoanalysis & that of psychoanalysis to itself as to the world
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis hasn’t yet treated DP, sovereignty in general, it needs to > otherwise, double resistance both of world to psychoanalysis & that of psychoanalysis to itself as to the world

PSSS.linkedContent: political force of psychoanalysis remains at odds w/ res publica, or even democracy of sovereignist concept (nation-statist), and at odds w/ publicity of its own institutionalization

PSSS.content: secrecy delimits political authority [re: institution of psychoanalysis]
PSSS.linkedContent: secrecy delimits political authority [re: institution of psychoanalysis]

PSSS.content: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]
PSSS.linkedContent: psychoanalysis only possible approach, w/out alibi, to all virtual translations btwn the cruelties of a suffering “for the pleasure of it” [?] [I you we cruel-suffer]

+R.content: picking out enlarged detail: indissociable demonstration of cinematographic & psychoanalytical technique > one & the same mutation [via Benjamin?]
+R.linkedContent: picking out enlarged detail: indissociable demonstration of cinematographic & psychoanalytical technique > one & the same mutation [via Benjamin?]

BSi.linkedContent: Lacan’s “return” to Freud [proclaimed loyalty to psychoanalytic tradition] both helps us & forbids us from thinking

BSi.content: acc. Deleuze, psychoanalytic bêtise privileges depth of fantasy over planar affect, becoming-assemblage

OG.linkedContent: [re: Being as transcendental signified] psychoanalysis presents best chance of breakthrough (percée) w/ concept-words of ontology

OG.content: Melanie Klein and psychoanalysis pays close attention to investments of writing, avoids derivation from theoretical formal ontology
OG.linkedContent: Melanie Klein and psychoanalysis pays close attention to investments of writing, avoids derivation from theoretical formal ontology

OG.content: [re: certain interpretation of Rousseau] Derrida wonders if the singularity of each substitution [for Rousseau’s mother] loses significance, each cleavage blurred, when a totalitarian psychoanalysis of existentialist or phenomenological nature claims diffuse, total, sexuality
OG.linkedContent: [re: certain interpretation of Rousseau] Derrida wonders if the singularity of each substitution [for Rousseau’s mother] loses significance, each cleavage blurred, when a totalitarian psychoanalysis of existentialist or phenomenological nature claims diffuse, total, sexuality

OG.linkedContent: doubling commentary is not psychoanalytic reading, not psychobiographical, where symptom is perfectly extrinsic, contingent, to text, where there’s an appeal to transcendental signified

OG.content: though Derrida is w/in history of psychoanalysis, he does not locate all the structures to which Rousseau’s text belongs, all that is not unique to it [like psychoanalysis would], all that could be inhabited rather than produced by writing > the encompassing already-thereness of language/culture

SPEC.content: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law
SPEC.linkedContent: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law

SPEC.content: autobiography of Freud as living description of his own writing, as if grandson were dictating to Freud what he had to set down on paper > not just tautological mirror, autobiography of the writing posits/deposits simultaneously—the psychoanalytic movement, elle performe et parie sur ce qui donna la chance [to psychoanalysis] > now Derrida: “je parie" that this double fort/da cooperates in initiating psychoanalysis
SPEC.linkedContent: autobiography of Freud as living description of his own writing, as if grandson were dictating to Freud what he had to set down on paper > not just tautological mirror, autobiography of the writing posits/deposits simultaneously—the psychoanalytic movement, elle performe et parie sur ce qui donna la chance [to psychoanalysis] > now Derrida: “je parie" that this double fort/da cooperates in initiating psychoanalysis

SPEC.content: does Freud want survival of psychoanalysis in his name? does its structure require it?
SPEC.linkedContent: does Freud want survival of psychoanalysis in his name? does its structure require it?

SPEC.content: monistic risk: in duel w/ Jung, Freud preferred dualism > whatever one says about Jung, Freudian dogmatism has been adopted blindly, inherited in this dark affair
SPEC.linkedContent: monistic risk: in duel w/ Jung, Freud preferred dualism > whatever one says about Jung, Freudian dogmatism has been adopted blindly, inherited in this dark affair

FV.content: what happens when a text that psychoanalysis deciphers inscribes w/in itself a scene of deciphering? when it says more about itself than the deciphering? [Freud often acknowledges this debt]
FV.linkedContent: what happens when a text that psychoanalysis deciphers inscribes w/in itself a scene of deciphering? when it says more about itself than the deciphering? [Freud often acknowledges this debt]

FV.content: débordement (not mastery of author), energetic squaring-off (carrure énergique)
FV.linkedContent: débordement (not mastery of author), energetic squaring-off (carrure énergique)

FV.content: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse

FV.content: Freud’s discourse: no more fiction than science
literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum
FV.linkedContent: literature that puts truth on stage, can it be read by psychoanalysis? abyssal structure, this space overflowed by powers of simulacrum

FV.content: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge
FV.linkedContent: even Freud [thus not Lacan] indicates, in Das Unheimliche, literary fiction’s resistance to general law of psychoanalytic knowledge

FV.content: analyst has seen what no one else has: place of the thing btwn the legs

FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, analyst links truth to power of speech: power of communication as a contract btwn 2 present things

FV.content: Lacan: when patient can speak to you (analyst) about himself [sic]—analysis is over
FV.linkedContent: Lacan: when patient can speak to you (analyst) about himself [sic]—analysis is over

FV.content: by way of Lacan, Freud tells us very literally Heidegger’s What is Metaphysics?
FV.linkedContent: by way of Lacan, Freud tells us very literally Heidegger’s What is Metaphysics?

FV.content: certain psychoanalytic interpretations (invisible framing: frame w/in frame) vs. scene of writing w/ ruined (abîmé) limits

FV.content: Dupin as the biggest dupe [not the master/analyst of truth, like Lacan believes], He-addresses-her-the-Queen-the-address-dupes-her (Il-l’adresse-la-Reine-l’adresse-la-dupe)
